column5: Done a couple in the last few years  Bonefish in Mexico Redfish in Florida  but my number one bucket list is a trip for big specks. Needs to have a good chance at fish above 5-6 lbs  Once I get that under my belt I want to get myself an Aurora and a Tiger tout. Then it's all down south - big bull reds in Louisiana, goliath grouper, hammerhead shark, tarpon to name a few
So much to see and do here in Canada, that would cover more than a couple of lifetimes.

So much to see and do here in Canada, that would cover more than a couple of lifetimes.  I don't think 20 lifetimes would cover Ontario Bruce. People all over the world are answering the same question on threads, I bet the most common choice is somewhere in Canada. We met a group from Indiana and Japan this year heading out on an Erie charter for these massive Walleye. The group from Japan were looking for 10" Perch as well.  A few years back I met a group of fishermen in Salisbury England. Struck up a conversation about fishing in the Pub. When I got back I Emailed them pics of a few Carp tipping 25  pounds and more from my back yard. The next year they rented a cottage down the road for a week in May. They have been coming back to Ontario every year since to fish. They pay less for their trips across the pond than a week in Southhampton or Bristol England in the summer.

Too many places I would like to fish.  Seeing how #sharkweek starts tomorrow. If I could only fish one place and if it were made legal to fish there. I would fish top water seal imitations off shark island South Africa for Great White Sharks!!!!  Out of your list though Costa Rica would be my choice.  Kamchatka Russia (for char and rainbows) would be high on my list as would West Africa (not now though. need to knock down that ebola thing) for gigantic tarpon. Mongolia for taimen, Thailand for some crazy cat fishing. Far off places like Easter and Christmas Islands would be some neat places to visit. New Zealand and Chille for the trout fishing and the Amazon for some of thier crazy    fish.  Sooooooo many places and too little time.
Maui for marlin.
Bahamas bonefish - Flyfishing
So many places to explore in this country first for me , top of my list is to get up to Plummer's and hit some trophy lake trout !

A few years back I met a group of fishermen in Salisbury England. Struck up a conversation about fishing in the Pub. When I got back I Emailed them pics of a few Carp tipping 25  pounds and more from my back yard. The next year they rented a cottage down the road for a week in May. They have been coming back to Ontario every year since to fish. They pay less for their trips across the pond than a week in Southhampton or Bristol England in the summer.  I had neighbours one summer in Peterborough, 4 professional guys from UK somewhere, they said it's cheaper to book their vacation time all together, fly to Canada, rent a student house for a month and fish their hearts out...cheaper to do that than it is to join a club back home...where you pay your membership fees, and then book the date, time slot and location on the river...crazy  we truly are blessed with fishing and hunting in Canada

If you could fish anywhere in the world, where would it be and what would it be for? I'm trying to plan something for next year and I'm torn between quite a few options. Barramundi in Australia, Peacock Bass in South America, Rooster Fish in Costa Rica, or largemouth bass on Falcon in Texas, El Salto in Mexico or Lake Biwi in Japan. Decisions, decisions!
Peacocks would be a blast. That would be my preference because of my addiction to topwater fishing for anything.

14 days in Guyana for arapaima, plus some exotic catfish and other species, 9 days fishing plus 5 jungle travel, travel days outside of the 14....trying to make it happen for 2016, can't convince any friends...need a diehard, somewhat crazy fly angler willing to shell out 4k (fly from TO)...you in? LOL

I'd also like to fly fish for taimen in malaysia before that fishery is completely run by american tour operators with jacked up prices...but a lot more money for that trip and won't happen quick enough  you could get your peacock bass in barramundi in florida, plus tarpon, snook and a bunch of other saltwater fish...bass too obviously
Fortunately, the wife's new job will allow me to fly pretty much anywhere in the world for pretty cheap.  I'm putting together a huge bucket list!! LOL

14 days in Guyana for arapaima, plus some exotic catfish and other species, 9 days fishing plus 5 jungle travel, travel days outside of the 14....trying to make it happen for 2016, can't convince any friends...need a diehard, somewhat crazy fly angler willing to shell out 4k (fly from TO)...you in? LOL  this 100x this!!!! bring out the 14wt fly rods!

I'm leaving in 17  hours for 16 glorious days on my twice yearly trip chasing muskies on the West Arm of Nippissing and for me, that's as good as it gets.  I'm not a very exotic person and I'm very easy to please
This trip intrigues the hell out of me. Like smallmouth on steroids.
...it would be the Kamchatka river in Eastern Russia.
Mackenzie River, NWT - Giant Northern Pike, Thousands of big Walleye, and cast after cast of Arctic Grayling & Whitefish
Poppin GT's in remote waters  http://www.worldsportfishing.com/3363-2/  Pretty sure you'd need this after a few days of that hehehe
heres the guyana trip, and if you get a chance to watch the whole documentary, do it! its amazing

this 100x this!!!! bring out the 14wt fly rods!   the14wt GLX is ready and desperately waiting....any takers? seriously...lol pm me for info  guessing your wife works with an airline? lucky dude...arapaima, taimen and wells catfish are top of the exotic list for me
I agree with Lew.  People in far away places dream of coming here to fish.

Tough to really nail down a specific trip. For me it would be a tour that involves deep sea, inshore/ coastal for a week followed by a few days of R&R and then move inland and sample some freshwater species. Most likely south America. Obviously need to narrow it down a bit....  Then again I could probably spend a month touring Ontario and not get bored. Lots of places in other provinces to see too.  We have it pretty good here.
South Pacific Ocean fighting a 1,000lb black marlin for 10hrs !!!!! Or off the queen Charlotte islands for 40-70lb chinook salmon !!!!! Oh ya

the14wt GLX is ready and desperately waiting....any takers? seriously...lol pm me for info  guessing your wife works with an airline? lucky dude...arapaima, taimen and wells catfish are top of the exotic list for me I'll sleep on it lol.  For me it would be the vid Brad posted, backcountry camping Norway for char, Russian salmon, New Zealand trout, Louisiana reds, Cape Cod stripers and I'd want to fish Russia for its trout as well.
My two are on your list. I saw a barramundi tournament on wfn one day and was sold.  Before that it would be the amazon for some peacocks.
... Canada.

Tons of places here in Ontario I need to visit. I have to do a fly-in for big northerns somewhere, brooktrout trip (borger adventure style), st. lawrence/ottawa for ski's, st. clair, etc. The list is long. Primarily, I'd love to do a week on LOTW. Hopefully next year!

Wow,nice bonus there Colin.   That would be a bucket list checked off.  Like others,Canada has so much to offer.  I would would be happy with a week of hand jigg,n cod out east.  What ever you chose,have a good one and look forward to the report.  B
Awesome input guys. We're definitely going to Australia next year but I think it's the Peacock bass thing that has me really excited.    guessing your wife works with an airline?

I've been blessed to have the opportunity to travel to every continent except Anartica. I don't want to drill a hole there!  100 pound plus Nile Perch in Africa. I would go back to Lynn Lake Manitoba in a heartbeat. No Ebola there I imagine.
Tree River Nunavut for giant Arctic char in August/September.
l.st clair. its a short trip but holds more specie then any other lake in Canada.
